name: getCSVClone
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a clone of the CSV tokenizer prototype.
 *
 * @return A cloned instance of the CSV tokenizer prototype.
 */

signature: public static StrTokenizer getCSVInstance(final String input)
name: getCSVInstance
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a new instance of CSV tokenizer.
 *
 * @param input the string to be tokenized
 * @return a new instance of CSV tokenizer
 */

name: getTSVClone
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a clone of the TSV tokenizer prototype.
 *
 * @return A new instance of the TSV tokenizer, cloned from the prototype.
 */

signature: public static StrTokenizer getTSVInstance(final String input)
name: getTSVInstance
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a new instance of TSV tokenizer.
 *
 * @param input The input string to be tokenized. This method will reset the
 *              tokenizer with the provided input.
 *
 * @return A new StrTokenizer instance, initialized with the given input.
 */

name: add
javadoc:
/**
 * Adds an object to this collection.
 *
 * @param obj the object to be added
 * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if adding objects is not supported by this collection
 */

signature: private void addToken(final List<String> list, String tok)
name: addToken
javadoc:
/**
 * Adds a token to the specified list.
 *
 * If the token is empty and {@link #isIgnoreEmptyTokens()} returns true, 
 * this method does nothing. Otherwise, if {@link #isEmptyTokenAsNull()} returns true,
 * an empty string is replaced with null in the list.
 *
 * @param list  the list to add the token to
 * @param tok   the token to be added
 */

name: checkTokenized
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if tokenization has been performed and performs it if necessary.
 * If no tokens have been set yet, this method will tokenize the input data
 * (either from a character array or null) and store the result in the 'tokens' field.
 *
 * @throws NullPointerException if the input data is not properly initialized
 */

name: clone
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates and returns a copy of this object.
 *
 * @return  a new instance of the same class as this object
 */

name: cloneReset
javadoc:
/**
 * Creates and returns a copy of this object, enabling 100% test coverage.
 *
 * @return A clone of the current StrTokenizer object
 * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if the object's class does not support the Cloneable interface
 */

name: getContent
javadoc: /** * Returns the content of this object as a string. * * @return the content, or null if no content is available */

name: getDelimiterMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a matcher for delimiters.
 *
 * @return A matcher that matches delimiters.
 */

name: getIgnoredMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the matcher used to match ignored strings.
 *
 * @return the matcher used to match ignored strings
 */

name: getQuoteMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the quote matcher.
 *
 * @return the quote matcher
 */

name: getTokenArray
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns an array of tokens.
 *
 * This method clones the internal token array to ensure thread-safety and
 * prevent external modifications.
 *
 * @return An array of tokens.
 */

name: getTokenList
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a list of tokens.
 *
 * @return A list of strings representing the tokens.
 */

name: getTrimmerMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns a matcher for trimming strings.
 *
 * @return A matcher that can be used to trim strings.
 */

name: hasNext
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if there are more elements to process.
 *
 * @return true if there are more elements, false otherwise
 */

name: hasPrevious
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if there are previous tokens.
 *
 * @return true if there are previous tokens, false otherwise
 */

name: isEmptyTokenAsNull
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks if an empty token should be treated as null.
 *
 * @return true if an empty token is considered null, false otherwise
 */

name: isIgnoreEmptyTokens
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns whether empty tokens should be ignored.
 *
 * @return true if empty tokens are to be ignored, false otherwise
 */

signature:
private boolean isQuote(final char[] srcChars,
                            final int pos,
                            final int len,
                            final int quoteStart,
                            final int quoteLen)
name: isQuote
javadoc:
/**
 * Checks whether a substring of characters in the source array matches a quoted string.
 *
 * @param srcChars  the character array to search in
 * @param pos       the starting position in the character array
 * @param len       the length of the character array
 * @param quoteStart the starting position of the quoted string within the character array
 * @param quoteLen   the length of the quoted string
 *
 * @return true if the substring matches the quoted string, false otherwise
 */

name: next
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the next token from the iterator.
 *
 * @return the next token, or null if there are no more tokens
 * @throws NoSuchElementException if there are no more tokens
 */

name: nextIndex
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the index of the next character to be processed.
 *
 * @return The index of the next character to be processed.
 */

name: nextToken
javadoc: /** * Retrieves the next token from the input stream. * * @return The next token, or null if there are no more tokens available. */

name: previous
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the previous token from the iterator.
 *
 * @return The previous token, or null if there are no more tokens.
 * @throws NoSuchElementException If there is no previous token.
 */

name: previousIndex
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the index of the previous character.
 *
 * This method returns the index of the character preceding the current
 * character, which is at {@link #tokenPos()}.
 *
 * @return The index of the previous character.
 */

name: previousToken
javadoc: /** * Returns the previous token from the input stream. * * @return The previous token, or null if there are no more tokens. */

signature:
private int readNextToken(final char[] srcChars,
                              int start,
                              final int len,
                              final StrBuilder workArea,
                              final List<String> tokenList)
name: readNextToken
javadoc:
/**
 * Reads the next token from the input character array.
 *
 * This method skips leading whitespace and handles tokens enclosed in quotes or separated by a delimiter.
 * It uses the provided {@link StrBuilder} to build the token and adds it to the {@link List} of tokens.
 *
 * @param srcChars  The input character array containing the data to be parsed.
 * @param start     The starting index of the current position in the input array.
 * @param len       The length of the input array.
 * @param workArea  A buffer used for building the token.
 * @param tokenList A list of tokens being built from the input data.
 *
 * @return The index at which the next token starts, or -1 if the end of the input has been reached.
 * @throws Exception If an error occurs during parsing (not explicitly documented as a possible exception).
 */

signature:
private int readWithQuotes(final char[] srcChars, final int start, final int len, final StrBuilder workArea,
                               final List<String> tokenList, final int quoteStart, final int quoteLen)
name: readWithQuotes
javadoc:
/**
 * Reads a token from the input source with quotes.
 *
 * This method reads a token from the input source and adds it to the token list.
 * It handles quoted strings by switching between quoting and non-quoting modes.
 * If a quote character is found, it checks if it's followed by another quote,
 * indicating an escaped quote. The method also handles delimiters, ignored characters,
 * and trimmed characters.
 *
 * @param srcChars the input source
 * @param start the starting position of the token in the input source
 * @param len the length of the token in the input source
 * @param workArea a temporary buffer to store the token
 * @param tokenList the list of tokens being built
 * @param quoteStart the starting position of the quote character in the input source
 * @param quoteLen the length of the quote character in the input source
 *
 * @return the ending position of the token in the input source, or -1 if the end of the string is reached
 */

name: remove
javadoc:
/**
 * Removes this element from the collection.
 *
 * This operation is not supported and will always throw an
 * {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.
 */

name: reset
javadoc: /** * Resets the tokenizer with a new input string. * * @param input The input string to tokenize. May be null to reset without changing the current state. * @return This tokenizer instance, allowing for chaining of calls. */

name: set
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets the object.
 *
 * This operation is currently unsupported and will always throw an
 * {@link UnsupportedOperationException}.
 *
 * @param obj the object to be set
 */

name: setDelimiterChar
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets the delimiter character used by this tokenizer.
 *
 * @param delim the new delimiter character
 * @return this tokenizer instance (for chaining)
 */

name: setDelimiterMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a custom delimiter matcher.
 *
 * @param delim the custom delimiter matcher to use, or null to reset to default behavior
 * @return this tokenizer instance for chaining
 */

name: setDelimiterString
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets the delimiter string used for tokenization.
 *
 * @param delim the new delimiter string
 * @return this tokenizer object, allowing for chaining of operations
 */

name: setEmptyTokenAsNull
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets whether an empty token should be treated as null.
 *
 * @param emptyAsNull true if an empty token should be treated as null, false otherwise
 * @return this tokenizer for method chaining
 */

name: setIgnoredChar
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a character to be ignored by this tokenizer.
 *
 * @param ignored The character to ignore. This value is passed to the
 *                {@link StrMatcher#charMatcher(char)} method to create a matcher.
 * @return This tokenizer instance, allowing method chaining.
 */

name: setIgnoredMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a matcher that will be used to ignore certain tokens.
 *
 * @param ignored the matcher to use for ignoring tokens, or null if no matcher should be used
 * @return this tokenizer instance (for chaining)
 */

name: setIgnoreEmptyTokens
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets whether to ignore empty tokens or not.
 *
 * @param ignoreEmptyTokens true if empty tokens should be ignored, false otherwise
 * @return this tokenizer instance for method chaining
 */

name: setQuoteChar
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets the character used to enclose quoted strings.
 *
 * @param quote the character to use as a quote
 * @return this tokenizer object
 */

name: setQuoteMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a custom matcher to match quotes.
 *
 * @param quote the custom matcher to use, or {@code null} to reset to default behavior
 * @return this tokenizer instance (for chaining)
 */

name: setTrimmerMatcher
javadoc:
/**
 * Sets a custom trimmer matcher for tokenization.
 *
 * @param trimmer the custom trimmer matcher to use, or {@code null} to reset
 *                to default behavior. If not {@code null}, it will be stored as
 *                the new trimmer matcher.
 * @return this tokenizer instance for method chaining.
 */

name: size
javadoc:
/**
 * Returns the number of tokens in the tokenized input.
 *
 * @return The number of tokens in the tokenized input.
 */

signature: protected List<String> tokenize(final char[] srcChars, final int offset, final int count)
name: tokenize
javadoc:
/**
 * Tokenizes the input character array into a list of strings.
 *
 * @param srcChars  The input character array to tokenize.
 * @param offset    The starting position in the input array to begin tokenization.
 * @param count     The number of characters in the input array to process.
 * @return          A list of tokens extracted from the input array.
 */
